simsim.gui
Interface Gui

All Known Implementing Classes:
GuiDesktop
public interface Gui

This interface contains the operations supported by the GUI of the simulator.

Author:
SÃ©rgio Duarte (smd@di.fct.unl.pt)

Method Detail

getMouseXY

XY getMouseXY()
Gets the coordinates of the mouse pointer.

Returns:
the (x,y) coordinates of the mouse pointer.

getMouseXY_Scaled

XY getMouseXY_Scaled(java.awt.Graphics2D gs)
Gets the coordinates of the mouse pointer transformed to a given graphics context object.

Parameters:
gs - A graphics context that contains the transformation to apply.
Returns:
the (x,y) coordinates of the mouse pointer.

addDisplayable

void addDisplayable(java.lang.String frame,
                    Displayable d,
                    double fps)
Adds a displayable item to the named internal frame. The frame is created as needed.

Parameters:
frame - The name of the frame.
d - The new displayable item.
fps - The desired framerate.

setFrameRectangle

void setFrameRectangle(java.lang.String frame,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int w,
                       int h)
Adds a displayable item to the named internal frame and sets its position and size. The frame is created as needed.

Parameters:
frame - The name of the internal frame.
x - The x coordinate of the frame window in the GUI desktop.
y - The y coordinate of the frame window in the GUI desktop.
w - The width of the frame window.
h - The height of the frame window.

setFrameTransform

void setFrameTransform(java.lang.String frame,
                       double virtualWidth,
                       double virtualHeight,
                       double offset,
                       boolean keepRatios)
Set the scaling transform use to scale (and translate) the graphics context of the frame.

Parameters:
frame - The name of the frame.
virtualWidth - The virtual width of the frame.
virtualHeight - The virtual height of the frame.
offset - A diagonal offset (translation) measure as a percentage.
keepRatios - A flag indicating if the scaled display are must keep the aspect ratio.
